sentence.idiomatic: Once I started working I particularly cherished the memories of university life.
I've lived here so long, but I still really miss my old house.
I really cherish the memories of the times I spent together with him.
That young fellow is not bad, he looks very cheerful.
Before he was really depressed. Now he's more and more cheerful.
She dressed very casually today, giving everyone a cheerful feeling.
He takes the initiative to greet everyone he meets.
How come he said hello to you? Do you know each other?
In the morning I said hello to him, but he ignored me.
The Shanghainese food this restaurant makes is very authentic.
Where can you get authentic steamed meat dumplings?
The quality is so poor, it's definitely not genuine.
He is taking this match very seriously.
It seems like the company isn't taking this project very seriously.
When traveling, one must take safety seriously.
I'm still not too accustomed to the life here.
This flavor is a little strange, but you just need to get used to it and it's fine.
I'm in the habit of drinking a glass of milk before bed.
You can enjoy the most attentive service here.
Yesterday we went to enjoy an authentic French meal.
Next year the people who live here will be able to enjoy having the convenience brought by the subway.
He still has two years and then he can retire.
After I retire I want to really enjoy life at home.
When are you retiring?
Have you been to Sydney?
Yeah, I used to go to university there. I really cherish the memories I have from there now.
Hey, did you see any kangaroos or koalas?
Of course I saw them. I saw koalas in the zoo. There were kangaroos in the forest right outside our school.
That's so great. The air quality in Sydney must be good.
Yes, and the weather is good too, so the people of Sydney have especially sunny dispositions. Walking down the street, even people who don't know each other will say hello.
Here people would think there was something wrong with you.
In Sydney it's really normal. It's a multicultural city, you can see people from all different countries, and you can find very authentic cuisine.
No wonder everyone who goes there gets fat.
But people from Sydney place a lot of importance on health. They particularly like outdoor activities--they are a part of their lives.
But a lot of people say it's really boring there.
Certainly it's a simpler place, but you just have to get used to it, and it's fine. Plus every day you can breathe fresh air, enjoy the sun and beach... it's so comfortable!
It's really a retirement heaven.
